definition[0]: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done
example[0]: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence.
example[1]: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
example[2]: Crash helmets are mandatory for motorcyclists.
definition[1]: something that is mandatory must be done, usually because the law or an official rule says so
example[3]: They face mandatory retirement at age 65.
